replies.body:
"Even if these things are seemed to be ridiculous, they are still vanilla, and the game changes from time to time. OCN (Project Ares?) is pretty keen on keeping stuff as close as vanilla as possible. If the game changes, we change. Not saying we should do this or that, just giving some food for thought I guess.

As long as you have high saturation you will keep regenning, right? But that saturation will go down even if you can't eat yet, so is it as bad as you say?

I don't think personally that we should stick to the "old game" constantly. As soon as a new update comes out, people want to stick with the older version. We might aswell had stopped updating (or removed features) after 1.6, right?"

-Brottweiler

It's happening
replies.body_tagged:
"Even if these things are seemed to be ridiculous, they are still vanilla, and the game changes from time to time. OCN (Project Ares?) is pretty keen on keeping stuff as close as vanilla as possible. If the game changes, we change. Not saying we should do this or that, just giving some food for thought I guess.

As long as you have high saturation you will keep regenning, right? But that saturation will go down even if you can't eat yet, so is it as bad as you say?

I don't think personally that we should stick to the "old game" constantly. As soon as a new update comes out, people want to stick with the older version. We might aswell had stopped updating (or removed features) after 1.6, right?"

-Brottweiler

It's happening

replies.body:
And why is that bad? It's a change in how we play, but we can still play and get good at the game.

To add to this, currently pvp is basically just who can spam click the fastest. I mean, there's a bit more to it, but 1v1's tend to be just a ton of spam clicking. It seems to me like Mojang is making pvp actually require a bit more skill in 1.9. Now you have to time your hits.
replies.body_tagged:
And why is that bad? It's a change in how we play, but we can still play and get good at the game.

To add to this, currently pvp is basically just who can spam click the fastest. I mean, there's a bit more to it, but 1v1's tend to be just a ton of spam clicking. It seems to me like Mojang is making pvp actually require a bit more skill in 1.9. Now you have to time your hits.

replies.body:
Hi guys. Back after a break from Avicus that really wasn't long enough. I'll probably only be here for like five seconds anyways.

Haven't played around with 1.9 all that much, but I'm pretty sure that you could just give everyone Haste 100 or something. Higher levels of the Haste effect make the attack cooldown timer shorter, so Haste 100 would probably be a temp. way of removing it.

Of course, you've still got shields, tipped arrows, and the special effects from swords and axes. Have fun getting rid of those.
replies.body_tagged:
Hi guys. Back after a break from Avicus that really wasn't long enough. I'll probably only be here for like five seconds anyways.

Haven't played around with 1.9 all that much, but I'm pretty sure that you could just give everyone Haste 100 or something. Higher levels of the Haste effect make the attack cooldown timer shorter, so Haste 100 would probably be a temp. way of removing it.

Of course, you've still got shields, tipped arrows, and the special effects from swords and axes. Have fun getting rid of those.
